findings.title: Potential Sandwich/MEV Attack In HLND
findings.description: The `swapTokensForBNB()` function is vulnerable to possible front-running attacks due to the lack of slippage control.

findings.title: Improved Logic In HLND::setAddressParameters()
findings.description: The `HLND` contract provides a privileged function for the `owner` to set various protocol-wide contract addresses. While examining the routine, we notice the current implementation logic can be improved.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The `transfer` function may expect a return value due to the `IERC20` interface definition, but some token contracts like `USDT` do not have a return value, which can cause reversion.

findings.title: Improved Precision By Multiplication And Division Reordering
findings.description: Potential precision loss due to multiplication and division order in HLND::_transfer() function, which can be improved by reordering operations.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the HLND protocol, there is a certain privileged account, i.e., owner. When examining the related contracts, we notice inherent trust on this privileged account.
